bibl.title: M. L. Coovert v. Clarke County. Stipulation
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21 US Circuit Courts, Western District of Washington, Seattle; Law Register Northern Division, 1890-1901, vol 1

div1.p:
In the Circuit Court of the United States, for the District of Washington, Northern Division. Ex parte M. L. Coovert } Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
that it It is hereby stipulated and agreed by and between C. E. S. Wood, Esq., Solicitor for Petitioner, M. L. Coovert, and C. D. Bowles, Esq., Solicitor for George Nerton, Sheriff, that the dimensions of the pine box from which the package of cigarettes attached to the petition in this case, as "Exhibit No.... was of the following dimensions to-wit: 16 inches long, 10 inches wide, 4 inches deep, and that said pine box was opened by the petitioner prior to the sale of said package to the said C. L. McDonald, but said package of ten cigarettes was not opened or smokes as one premises and it is further agreed that the said statement herein contained shall be made a part of the petition herein and considered as a part of the agreed statement of facts in this case.
C. E. S. Wood Solicitor for Petitioner.
C. D. Bowles Solicitor for George Nerton, Sheriff.

No. 275 In the Circuit Court of the United States for the District of Washington
Ex parte M. L. Coovert
Stipulation-
Filed June 22 1893 In the U.S. Circuit Court A. Reeves Ayres Clerk. By R. M. Hopkins Deputy.
